page.title: 14Living in the Area
page.content: Most residents seem to enjoy their life-styles, albeit that amenities are limited and less easily accessible than those enjoyed by a town or city dweller. Disadvantages have been traded for space, quiet, a rural setting and a sense of personal involvement with the area. Some young people are less enthus- iastic, feeling themselves cut off from school friends and the excitement of town events and amenities. Limited local employment and limited access to that further afield is also a source of concern. The quiet and rural atmosphere seems to generate a measure of independence and self-sufficiency, but the car, telephone and television seem to have become totally indispensible features of country life.
